Package me.masstrix.eternalnature.core.world

Class TemperatureScanner

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.masstrix.eternalnature.core.world.TemperatureScanner
  • public class TemperatureScanner
extends java.lang.Object
    Scans around a player to calculate the temperature of surrounding blocks.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      TemperatureScanner​(EternalNature plugin, UserData data, org.bukkit.entity.Player player)

    • Constructor Detail

      • TemperatureScanner

        public TemperatureScanner​(EternalNature plugin,
                          UserData data,
                          org.bukkit.entity.Player player)

    • Method Detail

      • setFidelity

        public void setFidelity​(int fidelity)
        Sets the fidelity of the scan. The higher this number is the moe iterations that have to be done to complete a full scan.
        Parameters:
        fidelity - new fidelity value.

      • setScanScale

        public void setScanScale​(int area,
                         int height)
        Sets the scan volume.
        Parameters:
        area - x z area to scan in.
        height - y scan height.

      • getTemperatureEmission

        public double getTemperatureEmission()
        Returns a value representing the emission temperature of blocks around a player.
        Returns:
        the emission value of the surrounding scanned area.

      • resetScanCycle

        public void resetScanCycle()
        Resets where the scan is in it's iteration process.

      • isDoneScanning

        public boolean isDoneScanning()
        Returns:
        if the current scan cycle is complete.

      • quickUpdate

        public void quickUpdate()
        Forces the a new quick scan of the players current area. This will have the lowest fidelity. Once run the temperature will be changed to the single scan using the players current location.

      • tick

        public void tick()
        Ticks the region scanner around the players location. The scanner will update it's values once it's done enought iterations to match the fidelity.
